bib.title: H-TFIDF: What makes areas specific over time in the massive flow of tweets related to the covid pandemic?
bib.author: Rémy Decoupes and Rodrique Kafando and Mathieu Roche and Maguelonne Teisseire
bib.abstract: Data produced by social networks may contain weak signals of possible epidemic outbreaks. In this paper, we focus on Twitter data during the waiting period before the appearance of COVID-19 first cases outside China. Among the huge flow of tweets that reflects a global growing concern in all countries, we propose to analyze such data with an adaptation of the TF-IDF measure. It allows the users to extract the discriminant vocabularies used across time and space. The results are then discussed to show how the specific spatio-temporal anchoring of the extracted terms make it possible to follow the crisis dynamics on different scales of time and space.
